page.title: 10TRANSPORT AROUND BURGHFIELD
page.content: Burghfield Common lies on a ridge about eight miles from Reading,the county town of Berkshire.Many of the inhabitants commute to work elsewhere, and require a good transport system. In the village itself,the main roads are Reading Road,Clayhill Road,and Recreation Road.Two Alder Valley bus services use these roads on the Reading to Baughurst route.The nearest railway station is in Mortimer,where trains run to Reading,to connect with the national network,or to Basingstoke ,to connect with the southern network. Most Burghfield families have two or more cars,and the national motorway network can be accessed on the M4 at either Three Mile Cross or at Theale. The A4,or "Bath Road",runs through Reading between London and Bath,and can be reached from Burghfield by the Reading (later Burghfield) Road.
